article.headline: Coronavirus tally: Global cases of COVID-19 hit 16.5 million, 654,327 deaths and Kentucky bars to close again
article.body: The global tally for confirmed cases of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 climbed to 16.5 million on Tuesday, according to data aggregated by Johns Hopkins University, and the death toll rose to 654,327. At least 9.6 million people have recovered. The U.S. case tally climbed to 4.29 million and the death toll rose to 148,056. Texas became the fourth state with more than 400,000 cases, joining California, Florida and New York. Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear is taking the advice offered at the weekend by Dr. Deborah Birx, coordinator of the White House Task Force created to manage the pandemic, who said Kentucky and several other states should reimpose shutdowns on bars and limit indoor gatherings to control the spread. Beshear ordered bars to close again for two weeks, starting Tuesday, the New York Times reported. Brazil is second to the U.S. with 2.4 million cases and 87,618 deaths. India is third measured by cases at 1.5 million, followed by Russia with 822,060 and South Africa with 452,529. The U.K. has 301,708 cases and 45,844 fatalities, the highest in Europe and third highest in the world. China, where the illness was first reported late last year, has 86,783 cases, and 4,656 fatalities.
